conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to give voice reminders that interrupt users often, but User Story B expects ALFRED to respond easily and independently to voice commands without frequent interruptions. These opposite expectations about voice interaction behavior create a conflict.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to give smart voice reminders that interrupt users often, so I can improve adherence even if users do not like it.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person with mild mobility issues, I want to use voice commands to control ALFRED easily and independently.
resolutionDescription: Adjusted both user stories to balance reminder frequency and voice command ease, allowing reminders that respect user control and reduce frequent interruptions.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to give smart voice reminders that are helpful but not too frequent, so users stay engaged without annoyance.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult with mild mobility issues, I want ALFRED to respond easily to my voice commands without frequent interruptions, so I can control it comfortably.
